title: Pas mal mais ne vaut que moyennement le d√©placement de Cotonou
text: Comme la plupart des autres sites que j‚Äôai voulu visiter au B√©nin, ce palais-musee √©tait en r√©novation. On pouvait n√©anmoins en visiter une partie, ce qui a √©t√© int√©ressant au moins autant par la le√ßon d‚Äôhistoire de l‚Äôexcellent guide que pour le palais lui-m√™me et les quelques vestiges qui y restaient, tous deux assez d√©cevants.
translated_title: Not bad but only moderately worth the trip from Cotonou
translated_text: Like most of the other sites I wanted to visit in Benin, this palace-museum was under renovation. It was nevertheless possible to visit part of it, which was interesting at least as much for the history lesson from the excellent guide as for the palace itself and the few vestiges that remained there, both rather disappointing.

title: Mus√©e Honm√© et Palais du roi Te Agbanlin √† Hogbonou ( Porto Novo ), Patrimoine en p√©ril !!
text:
Ce mus√©e dit Honm√© , √©tabli dans l'ancien palais du roi Te Agbanlin (1710-1760) , de Hogbonou , aujourd'hui Porto Novo ( Sud Est du B√©nin) , date de 1725 . A cette √©poque , le puissant  royaume d'Abomey envahit celui d 'Allada ( centre Sud du B√©nin actuel ). Ce qui conduit son roi √† se r√©fugier √† Hogbonou o√π depuis 1600 le fr√®re du Premier roi d'Abomey Gangnihessou (1600-1620) , y a r√©gn√©. Autant dire qu'il s'agit d'une histoire de famille ,mais qu'importe. 

Le roi Te Agbanlin , √† son arriv√©e, trouve une situation difficile o√π les musulmans Yoruba venus du Nig√©ria voisin (Royaume d'Oyo ) , occupent la cit√© . Ici nous rentrons dans la l√©gende avec l'intervention du Dieu vaudou de la nuit, Zangbeto , qui √©loigne les mauvais esprits et du coup les occupants Yoruba sont chass√©s .( SIC)

La dynastie, qui s'y √©tablie, r√®gnera jusqu'en 1882 quand,  pour se prot√©ger de ses ennemis du royaume du Dahomey associ√© √† celui de Ouidah ( Sud Ouest du B√©nin actuel)  , le roi Toffa de Porto Novo (1874-1908) , se met sous la protection de la France . Un accord de protectorat est conclu avec Paris .
Face √† cette situation de menace de la part du royaume du Dahomey , la France prend pr√©texte et engage les hostilit√©s contre le roi B√©hanzin d'Abomey . En 1894 la France , qui a vaincu toute opposition , √©tablit la colonie du Dahomey . Le port de Porto Novo est florissant ainsi que la cit√© . Le royaume  ne sera int√©gr√©e √† la colonie du Dahomey qu'√† la mort du roi Toffa en 1908 .  

La visite est d√©cevante , du fait de la v√©tust√© des lieux et ce malgr√© les explications du guide. Le palais est construit en terre rouge de la r√©gion qui , au fil du temps , lui donne une patine grise , faute de restauration  . Il n'y a aucun meuble les pi√®ces sont vides .L' interdiction de prendre des photos , est de mon point de vue contre productive pour la promotion du site . Ceci √©tant dit , vue l'√©tat des lieux , ce n'est peut √™tre pas souhaitable pour l'instant . Le gouvernement b√©ninois , conscient de la valeur symbolique et touristique du patrimoine , "devrait" engager un programme de r√©novation . Je pr√©cise aussi que certaines photos qui apparaissent ne correspondent absolument pas √† ce lieu , notamment la photo de couverture . Cela a √©t√© signal√© , mais rien ne bouge !!

Nous entrons dans chaque pi√®ce par une porte basse , qui oblige √† se courber et nous sortons par la grande porte , initialement r√©serv√©e au seul Roi . 
Les pi√®ces se succ√®dent , avec des fonctions tr√®s pr√©cises comme , le vestibule , la salle de r√©ception , la salle de la Reine M√®re , etc Puis on acc√®de √† la salle du Conseil du Roi , Etrangement , une cour √† toit ouvert entour√©e de coursives , poss√®de une cabane tr√®s sommaire en branche en son milieu . C'√©tait para√Æt il le lieu o√π le jeune roi commen√ßait son apprentissage et o√π ,  ensuite il pouvait se retirer pour m√©diter .
L'espace r√©serv√© aux multiples √©pouses du roi , sous la surveillance de la Reine m√®re. , est √† toit ouvert , avec un bassin central vide au milieu d'une coursive . 
Enfin, nous terminons la visite du palais par un grand espace en herbe rase entour√© de gradins couverts pour le roi et les dignitaires  et de banquettes pour les spectateurs . Cet espace √©tait r√©serv√© pour les manifestations royales .
A l'ext√©rieur ,on peut voir l'arbre de justice puis le tribunal ,avec les attributs traditionnels . 

Des ≈ìuvres d'Art inspir√©es du Vaudou , sont expos√©es devant l'entr√©e , comme le Dieu de la foudre,  un serviteur royal au crane ras√© , un laboureur , un √©trange personnage style robot Antique ou encore un facteur √† v√©lo , m√©tallique et rouill√© . C'est de l'art certes , mais un peu d√©sordonn√© !!
Le terme " Honm√© " d√©signe " ce qui est √† l'int√©rieur de la porte " par extension " le Palais "
translated_title: Honm√© Museum and Palace of King Te Agbanlin in Hogbonou (Porto Novo), Heritage in danger!!
translated_text: This museum called Honm√©, established in the former palace of King Te Agbanlin (1710-1760), of Hogbonou, today Porto Novo (South East of Benin), dates from 1725. At that time, the powerful kingdom of Abomey invaded that of Allada (central South of current Benin). This led its king to take refuge in Hogbonou where since 1600 the brother of the First King of Abomey Gangnihessou (1600-1620), reigned. Suffice to say that it is a family story, but what does it matter. King Te Agbanlin, upon his arrival, found a difficult situation where the Yoruba Muslims from neighboring Nigeria (Kingdom of Oyo), occupied the city. Here we enter the legend with the intervention of the voodoo God of the night, Zangbeto, who drives away the evil spirits and suddenly the Yoruba occupants are driven out. (SIC) The dynasty, which was established there, will reign until 1882 when, to protect itself from its enemies in the kingdom of Dahomey associated with that of Ouidah (South West of current Benin), King Toffa of Porto Novo (1874-1908), puts himself under the protection of France. A protectorate agreement is concluded with Paris. Faced with this situation of threat from the kingdom of Dahomey, France takes pretext and engages in hostilities against King B√©hanzin of Abomey. In 1894 France, which has overcome all opposition, establishes the colony of Dahomey. The port of Porto Novo is flourishing as well as the city. The kingdom was not integrated into the colony of Dahomey until the death of King Toffa in 1908. The visit was disappointing, due to the dilapidated state of the place, despite the guide's explanations. The palace is built of red earth from the region, which, over time, has given it a gray patina, due to lack of restoration. There is no furniture, the rooms are empty. The ban on taking photos is, in my opinion, counterproductive for the promotion of the site. That being said, given the state of the place, it may not be desirable for the moment. The Beninese government, aware of the symbolic and tourist value of the heritage, "should" initiate a renovation program. I also point out that some of the photos that appear do not correspond at all to this place, notably the cover photo. This has been reported, but nothing is happening!! We enter each room through a low door, which requires bending over, and we exit through the large door, initially reserved for the King alone. The rooms follow one another, with very specific functions such as the vestibule, the reception room, the Queen Mother's room, etc. Then we access the King's Council room. Strangely, an open-roofed courtyard surrounded by walkways has a very basic branch-shaped hut in the middle. This was apparently the place where the young king began his apprenticeship and where he could then retire to meditate. The space reserved for the king's multiple wives, under the supervision of the Queen Mother, has an open roof, with an empty central basin in the middle of a walkway. Finally, we end the visit of the palace with a large space of short grass surrounded by covered stands for the king and dignitaries and benches for spectators. This space was reserved for royal events. Outside, you can see the tree of justice and then the courthouse, with its traditional attributes. Works of art inspired by Voodoo are exhibited in front of the entrance, such as the God of lightning, a royal servant with a shaved head, a ploughman, a strange character in the style of an Antique robot or even a postman on a bicycle, metallic and rusty. It is art, certainly, but a little messy!! The term "Honm√©" designates "what is inside the door" by extension "the Palace"

title: Not much to see, interesting story.
text: Interesting content in term of history. Not much to see. Unfortunately, the guide was selfish, unable to interact and really ruined the visit.
translated_title: Not much to see, interesting story.
translated_text: Interesting content in term of history. Not much to see. Unfortunately, the guide was selfish, unable to interact and really ruined the visit.

title: The place is uninspiring, but the stories are fascinating
text: Do not expect much of this building. The guide, though, who does speak fluent English, will show you around, and his stories are quite amazing, You get to see some old photos of the 112 queens who belonged to the last king as well as the queen mother (who was actually and aunt). Worth 10 -15 minutes
translated_title: The place is uninspiring, but the stories are fascinating

The guide, though, who does speak fluent English, will show you around, and his stories are quite amazing, You get to see some old photos of the 112 queens who belonged to the last king as well as the queen mother (who was actually and aunt). title: mus√©e honm√®
text: il a fallu y aller pour redecouvrir les traces laiss√©es par les anciens roi de la ville de porto-novo au b√©nin
translated_text: We had to go there to rediscover the traces left by the ancient kings of the city of Porto-Novo in Benin.

title: Royal Heritage
text:
On getting to this historical and royal palace that has been converted into a museum, what I noticed was that the people and management work very hard to preserve the place.

This museum shows the life and greatness of former king Toffa and family. 

Outside the museum, I mean it's environment, you will see the indigenous people in their real self and it is easy to study the people and learn their ways.
translated_text:
On getting to this historical and royal palace that has been converted into a museum, what I noticed was that the people and management work very hard to preserve the place.

This museum shows the life and greatness of former king Toffa and family. 

Outside the museum, I mean it's environment, you will see the indigenous people in their real self and it is easy to study the people and learn their ways.

title: Interesting stories, a little run down as a museum
text: You basically see the building, because there are hardly any furnishings or decorations.  But the stories they tell you about how the kings ruled and about the succession process are fascinating.
translated_title: Interesting stories, a little run down as a museum
translated_text: You basically see the building, because there are hardly any furnishings or decorations.  But the stories they tell you about how the kings ruled and about the succession process are fascinating.

title: A voir. Riche sur les pratiques royales. Guide interessant
text:
A voir pour en savoir plus sur la fa√ßon dont les rois vivaient.  Et t√©moigne de Ne riche histoire des rois dans l ex Benin
Ne pas h√©siter √† faire la visite guid√©e
translated_title: Worth seeing. Rich in information on royal practices. Interesting guide.
translated_text: To see to learn more about how the kings lived. And bears witness to the rich history of the kings in the former Benin. Do not hesitate to take the guided tour.

title: A voir ppur le poids historique, mais bof
text: Pas grand chose a voir, mais fait partit du patrimoine du pays . Cela di il y a des dizaines de palais.
translated_title: To see for the historical weight, but meh
translated_text: Not much to see, but it's part of the country's heritage. That said, there are dozens of palaces.

title: palais royal honme
text: le palais royal honme se situe en pleine ville de porto-novo au benin notament dans le quartier akpassa non loin du colege akpassa
translated_text: The royal palace is located in the heart of Porto-Novo in Benin, notably in the Akpassa district, not far from Akpassa College.

title: visite
text: musee honme se situe au benin notamentdans la ville de portonovo precisement dans la commune de akpassa.il faut  y aller pour visiter et avoir surtout une idee sur l'histoire de la ville de porto-novo fin de citation
translated_text: The Mus√©e Honme is located in Benin, particularly in the town of Porto-Novo, specifically in the commune of Akpassa. You have to go there to visit and, above all, to get an idea of the history of the town of Porto-Novo. End of quote.

title: Grande
text: Si tratta del primo e unico palazzo reale ben tenuto nel Benin. Con l'ausilio di una guida si visita l'impianto e vi viene a conoscenza dello stile di vita nel paese tra il 1600 e il 1800 circa.
translated_text: Si tratta del primo e unico palazzo reale ben tenuto nel Benin. Con l'ausilio di una guida si visita l'impianto e vi viene a conoscenza dello stile di vita nel paese tra il 1600 e il 1800 circa.

title: Palace of the kings
text: If you visit Porto Novo than it is a must to visit the museums there. Take a look at the lifestyle of the Kings from the past. It is nice to see how they lived.
translated_text: If you visit Porto Novo than it is a must to visit the museums there. Take a look at the lifestyle of the Kings from the past. It is nice to see how they lived.

title: kul place to be
text: hmmmm, is the right word to start with for me to tell you how nice the palace was. i really enjoyed every bit of time i spent walking around the palace trying to know its history. i bet you will never regret going there with your family this holiday

title: Un palais plein d'une histoire singuli√®re
text: Palais est un mot inadapt√© pour l'id√©e que peut s'en faire l'europ√©en moyen... Il s'agit en effet de la demeure -mal entretenue faute de moyens- des rois de Porto-Novo dont on d√©couvre la vie √† travers la visite guid√©es des pi√®ces qui avaient chacune une destination particuli√®re : des chambres de la reine m√®re aux salles de bains des femmes, de l‚Äôesplanade des audience et des f√™tes jusqu'au au r√©duit o√π devait s'enfermer le roi pour mourir en cas de d√©faite... Le guide joue un r√¥le primordial pour la visite. Une √©tape incontournable pour conna√Ætre le B√©nin !
translated_title: A palace full of a unique history
translated_text: Palace is an unsuitable word for the idea that the average European might have of it... It is in fact the residence - poorly maintained due to lack of means - of the kings of Porto-Novo whose life we discover through the guided tour of the rooms which each had a particular purpose: from the queen mother's bedrooms to the women's bathrooms, from the esplanade of audiences and celebrations to the redoubt where the king had to lock himself away to die in the event of defeat... The guide plays a vital role in the visit. An essential step to get to know Benin!

title: Bien
text: Vous √™tes √† Porto-Novo, alors allez voir ce palais restaur√©. les commentaires sont int√©ressants, le guide, Monsieur Fran√ßois, fac√©tieux; Mais ne vous attendez pas √† autre chose qu'√† des b√¢timents de construction traditionnelle, vides... ou presque. Nous avons rencontr√© le roi de Porto-Novo, qui vit dans un autre "palais", un peu par hasard, mais le guide peut apparemment organiser une audience. Sa majest√© est fort aimable et explique √† merveille l'histoire de Porto-Novo et de sa famille.
translated_text: You're in Porto-Novo, so go see this restored palace. The commentary is interesting, the guide, Mr. Fran√ßois, facetious; but don't expect anything other than traditionally constructed buildings, empty... or almost. We met the King of Porto-Novo, who lives in another "palace," somewhat by chance, but the guide can apparently arrange an audience. His Majesty is very kind and explains the history of Porto-Novo and his family wonderfully.

title: Enjoyed the stories from the museum guide
text: This is different from the Royal Palace in Abomey. Much more recent. Worth a visit to learn more about the local history.
translated_title: Enjoyed the stories from the museum guide
translated_text: This is different from the Royal Palace in Abomey. Much more recent. Worth a visit to learn more about the local history.

title: so much history
text: I liked the way of presenting and guiding through the museum
translated_text: I liked the way of presenting and guiding through the museum

title: √† ne pas manquer
text:
la visite du palais honm√© est incontournable pour qui visite Porto-Novo.
un palais qui a abrit√© quasiment toute la dysnastie des rois de Porto-Novo. un peu vide, un peu nu, mais le mus√©e n'est pas en afrique ce qu'il est en europe.
batisse de plein pied de plusieurs hectares avec batiments, cours int√©rieures, photos associ√©es : impressionnant tout de m√™me et un guide interressant.
par contre le"centre artisanal" est une plaisanterie et la boutique : dommage que les livres pr√©sent√©s √† la vente ne soient , pour certains, plus √©dit√©s. j'ai achet√© le dernier exemplaire d'un de ceux-ci.
mais je n'ai pas regrett√© ma visite.
on peut y prendre des photos.
translated_text: A visit to the Palais Honm√© is a must for anyone visiting Porto-Novo. A palace that housed almost the entire dynasty of the kings of Porto-Novo. A little empty, a little bare, but the museum is not in Africa what it is in Europe. A single-story building of several hectares with buildings, interior courtyards, associated photos: impressive all the same and an interesting guide. On the other hand, the "craft center" is a joke and the shop: it's a shame that some of the books presented for sale are no longer published. I bought the last copy of one of them. But I did not regret my visit. You can take photos there.
